result.execSummary:
The defendant Gloria J Branch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500, Classification of Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay a fine in the amount of $150 plus all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, within 90 days.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  Restitution is set at zero.
Defendant to serve 1 day in the House of Correction, with 1 day credit for time served.  Time Served Disposition.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gloria J Branch

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Gloria J Branch
Current: 3604 9TH AVE, South Milwaukee, WI 53172 United States  (Effective: 10-19-2015)
Prior: 4237 N. 44th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Bankruptcy Stay placed on 10/19/15 for bankruptcy case no. 15-31090.

Notice of Chapter 7 Bankruptcy Case, Meeting of Creditors, and Deadlines received from CMC on 10/8/15.  Bankruptcy case number 15-31090.  Bankruptcy filed 10/2/15.  All court cases include 14CF1537 $502.
Updated address from information on Notice of Chapter 7 Bankruptcy form.

Defendant Gloria J Branch in court with attorney Robert L. Taylor.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.  

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED TO A MISDEMEANOR):   Court ordered defendant to serve 1 day in the House of Correction, with 1 day credit for time served.  
TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Defendant is to pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges within 90 days from today's date.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Defendant is to pay the DNA surcharge within 90 days from today's date.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Defendant is to pay a fine in the amount of $150.00 within 90 days from today's date.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Restitution set at ZERO.

FILED:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Gloria J Branch in court with attorney Robert L. Taylor.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Jury Trial today, however, the parties have now reached an agreement.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 AMENDED to:  Theft (Value Does Not Exceed $2500) [a Class A MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(1)(a).

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED TO A MISDEMEANOR):    Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

filed by ADA Bruce Landgraf on behalf of the State.  Count 1 is AMENDED to:  Theft (Value Does Not Exceed $2500) [a Class A MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a), 939.51(1)(a).
filed by ADA Bruce Landgraf on behalf of the State.

Attorney Robert L. Taylor appeared TELEPHONICALLY.  Defendant is excused today; not a scheduled hearing.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared TELEPHONICALLY for the State of Wisconsin.

Court is not available on the Jury Trial date on 11-19-2014 at 8:30 AM; Judge Donald is attending a judicial conference.
Case is rescheduled to 01-07-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Jury Trial.
Atty. Taylor to notify the defendant.
Clerk CANCELLED the 11-19-2014 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date before Judge Donald's Court.
Defense Attorney's Motion to Withdraw as Attorney of Record filed by Atty. Robert Taylor.

Defendant Gloria J Branch in court with attorney Robert L. Taylor.  Bruce J. Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**Atty. Taylor moves to withdraw his motion to withdraw as attorney of record.
No objections.
Court "allows" Atty. Taylor to withdraw his motion to withdraw as attorney of record.

Statements made.
Parties remain in a trial posture and request to adjourn the trial date.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned for Adjourned Jury Trial on 11-19-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

**Court CANCELLED the 09-18-2014 at 8:30 Jury Trial date before Judge Donald's Court.

Defendant Gloria J Branch in court with attorney Robert L Taylor.  Bruce J Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 09-10-2014 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 09-18-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Defendant Gloria J Branch in court with attorney Robert L Taylor.  Bruce J Landgraf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gloria J Branch in court with attorney Robert L Taylor.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/6/2014 at 1:00pm
